intro: Anodiscus, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, often violet-colored flowers. The plants typically have palmately lobed leaves and are often grown as ornamental plants due to their aesthetic appeal. Anodiscus species are usually shrubs or small trees, and they thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Their flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to their ecological significance in their native habitats.
